title: Relative paths for target tools in config.toml don't work consistently
body:
I want to build Rust using a non-system toolchain. I'd like to point bootstrap to my tools using relative paths. For example, to build with Clang from a Chromium checkout, I tried the following config.toml:
```[build]
target = ["x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu"]

[target.x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu]
cc = "../../chromium/src/third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/clang"
cxx = "../../chromium/src/third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/clang++"
ar = "../../chromium/src/third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/llvm-ar"
ranlib = "../../chromium/src/third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/llvm-ranlib"
linker = "../../chromium/src/third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/clang"
```

But this doesn't work. The build system seems to assume paths are absolute, or are files in the PATH. When building several steps fail to find the specified tools.

Building with `./x.py build --stage 0 library/std` gives the following:
```
Updating only changed submodules
  Submodules updated in 0.01 seconds
Building rustbuild
...
error: linker `../../chromium/src/third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/clang` not found
  |
  = note: No such file or directory (os error 2)

error: could not compile `log` due to previous error
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
failed to run: /usr/local/google/home/collinbaker/rust/rust/build/x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage0/bin/cargo build --manifest-path /usr/local/google/home/collinbaker/rust/rust/src/bootstrap/Cargo.toml
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:00:02
```

If I patch [build_bootstrap in src/bootstrap/bootstrap.py](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/cfa4ac66c194046f631ce076c75516ecfdeb77ee/src/bootstrap/bootstrap.py#L1009) to append `" -C linker=" + os.path.join(self.rust_root, target_linker)` to `env["RUSTFLAGS"]` instead of `" -C linker=" + target_linker`, that build passes but a new failure comes up:
```
...
Building stage0 std artifacts (x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu -> x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu)
   Compiling cc v1.0.69
   Compiling core v0.0.0 (/usr/local/google/home/collinbaker/rust/rust/library/core)
   Compiling libc v0.2.108
   Compiling memchr v2.4.1
   Compiling std v0.0.0 (/usr/local/google/home/collinbaker/rust/rust/library/std)
error: linker `../../chromium/src/third_party/llvm-build/Release+Asserts/bin/clang` not found
  |
  = note: No such file or directory (os error 2)

error: could not compile `memchr` due to previous error
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: build failed
Build completed unsuccessfully in 0:00:57
```
